channel.title: Posts on Sam Ginzburg
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Sam Ginzburg

item.title: The Practicality - Usability Exploit Gap
item.description: Introduction Over the past few years, there has been tremendous fervor over the existence of various side and covert channel vulnerabilities. Some of which, such as the Meltdown [1] and Spectre [2] variants are extremely usable, and others such as [3] which are only practical for now. I hope in this post to answer what the difference between a practical attack and a usable attack is, why it matters at all, and how we can tell when attacks start to move from practical to usable.
